author: Geoff Wisner
title: ‘Speak No Evil’ Review: The Dangerous Passage to Manhood
text:
In 2005, the Nigerian-American writer Uzodinma Iweala published his first novel. He had just turned 23, having graduated from Harvard the year before.
“Beasts of No Nation” was a tale of suffering and violence told by a child soldier in an unnamed African country. The book was an enormous success, winning for its author a raft of awards and a spot on Granta’s list of 20 best young American novelists. A movie version starred Idris Elba as the sinister Commandant.
